/home/project/src/guidelines/Guidelines..content: # Project Guidelines: The Bamboo Bistro ## 1. Project Overview "The Bamboo Bistro" is a modern Asian casual dining website website concept. **Key Aesthetics:** "Harmony & Energy". It blends traditional Japanese/Asian aesthetics (calligraphy, bamboo, verticality) with modern city vibes (neon, industrial textures, deep indigo/charcoal modes). The site feels "noisy, crowded, and absolutely delicious" (Umami). ## 2. Tech Stack - **Framework:** React (Vite) - **Styling:** Tailwind CSS (v4.0) - **Animation:** Motion (formerly Framer Motion) - **Routing:** React Router DOM (`react-router-dom`) - **Icons:** Lucide React - **Layout:** React Responsive Masonry (for galleries) ## 3. Design System & Tokens ### Colors - **Backgrounds:** Deep, dark tones. `bg-neutral-950` (Main), `bg-neutral-900` (Sections), `bg-indigo-950` (Navigation/Accents). - **Primary Accent:** Neon Red (`text-red-500`, `bg-red-600`) - used for CTAs, dividers, and emphasis. - **Secondary Accent:** Emerald Green (`text-emerald-400`) - used for "freshness" cues (ingredients). - **Text:** High contrast White (`text-white`) or muted Gray (`text-neutral-400`) for body. - **Gradients:** `from-red-500 to-orange-500` (Heat/Fire). ### Typography - **Headings:** Bold, Uppercase, Tight Tracking (`tracking-tight`, `tracking-tighter`). - **Eyebrows/Labels:** Small, Uppercase, Wide Tracking (`tracking-widest`, `text-xs`). - **Vertical Text:** Used frequently for rhythm. Utility: `[writing-mode:vertical-rl]` or custom class `writing-mode-vertical`. - **Serif:** Used sparingly for italicized emphasis (e.g., *"Soul in a Bowl"*). ### UI Patterns - **Vertical Rhythm:** Vertical lines (`w-[1px] h-32 bg-red-500`) and vertical text to mimic rain/bamboo/calligraphy. - **Masonry Grids:** For image galleries ("Atmosphere Wall"). - **Glassmorphism:** `backdrop-blur-md` and `bg-white/5` for overlays. - **Interactive Hovers:** Images scale up (`scale-105`), grayscale to color transitions. ## 4. Project Structure ``` / ├── components/ │ ├── figma/ # Utilities (ImageWithFallback) │ ├── layout/ # Global Layout, Navigation, Footer │ ├── pages/ # Route components (HomePage, MenuPage, etc.) │ ├── sections/ # Homepage specific sections (Hero, Culture, etc.) │ └── ui/ # ShadCN or generic UI components ├── data/ │ └── content.ts # Single source of truth for text/images ├── guidelines/ # Project documentation ├── imports/ # Static assets (SVGs) └── App.tsx # Router configuration ``` ## 5. Coding Standards ### Data Driven - All text content, image URLs, and navigation links must reside in `/data/content.ts`. - Components should import `siteContent` and destructure the relevant section. - **Goal:** The site content should be editable without touching the React components. ### Styling - **Tailwind First:** Use standard utility classes. Avoid custom CSS modules. - **Layouts:** Use Flexbox and Grid heavily. - **Spacing:** Use consistent spacing scales (py-24 for sections, gap-6/8 for grids). - **Dark Mode Default:** The site is designed in "Dark Mode" by default. Light mode is not supported. ### Images - **Component:** ALWAYS use `` from `../components/figma/ImageWithFallback` instead of ``. - **Source:** Use Unsplash URLs with parameters for optimization (`w=800`, `q=80`). - **Styling:** Images often use `grayscale` by default and reveal color on hover. ### Routing - Use `Link` from `react-router-dom` for internal navigation. - Active states in navigation should be visually distinct (e.g., red indicator line). - Ensure `ScrollToTop` behavior is implemented so pages start at the top on navigation. ## 6. Extension Guidelines - **Adding a Page:** 1. Create the component in `/components/pages/`. 2. Add the route in `/App.tsx`. 3. Update `/data/content.ts` navigation array. - **Animation:** - Use `motion.div` for entrance animations (fade up, stagger). - Keep animations subtle (`duration: 0.5`, `y: 20` -> `y: 0`). - **New Sections:** - Follow the "Container -> Content" pattern. - Ensure responsive design (mobile: stacked, desktop: grid/flex).
